revised_title: Comparative Histology of the Mammalian Cerebral Cortex in Insectivora
tldr: The author examines the structure and function of the cerebral cortex in Insectivora, specifically the Mole, Shrew, and Hedgehog. They identify distinct areas of the cortex and analyze the lamination and cell layers, concluding that the Mole and Shrew have more specialized motor cortex due to their greater motor accomplishments compared to the Hedgehog.
